milestones.text: Start with the basics: Get to know Unity’s user interface by participating in tutorials from Unity’s official website.
Demo projects: Download some of the sample projects provided by Unity to get accustomed to the environment.
Learn about the tools: Investigate its integrated tools for animation, design and editing.
3D fundamentals: Understand 3D graphics from the basics such as geometry, materials, lighting and textures.
Move to scripting: Get a good understanding of C# in order to be able to code scripts within the engine.
Make a project: Pick a project or game template, then start experimenting and building.
Share your work: Upload the working project to platforms such as itch.io, then share it with the world.
Iterate and refine: Get feedback from users, then improve the project using the features in Unity.
